intro: Dysophylla stellata var. roxburghiana, commonly known as the star-shaped dysophylla, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are arranged in clusters. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species in botanical studies and horticulture.
